policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's use of visuals in sustainability claims is consistent with the product's characteristics.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should also be aware of the overall impression a visual presentation of a claim can create. The images, logos and colours used are an important part of the overall presentation of a claim. Firms should consider how images, logos and colours together may be perceived by the audience when presented alongside other sustainability characteristics of a product or service. Claims may be undermined if what they say is factually correct, but their visual presentation conveys a different impression.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's social media communications are clearly identifiable as financial promotions when applicable.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: There is a specific requirement that financial promotions for investment products3 are identifiable as such. Our view is that – for social media in particular – it is important that, in all cases, it is clear that a promotion is a promotion. This can be by labelling the promotion as such, or it may be clear from the context.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that all TSB's social media communications are clear, fair, and not misleading.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: We remind firms that, under Principle 7 of the Principles for Businesses, it remains a fundamental requirement that all communications (including financial promotions) are clear, fair and not misleading. Promotions that fail to be 'clear, fair and not misleading' can pose a risk as they could lead consumers to buy the wrong product – ultimately with unhappy outcomes for them and for firms.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB includes appropriate risk warnings in social media promotions where required.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: We remind firms that there are requirements to include risk warnings or other statements in promotions for certain products/services. These rules are media-neutral and therefore apply to social media as they would to any other medium. When taken into account with our supervisory approach to standalone compliance, this poses particular challenges for the use of character-limited social media.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Confirm that TSB's social media promotions are standalone compliant.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Each communication (e.g. a tweet, a Facebook insertion or page, or web page) needs to be considered individually and comply with the relevant rules.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB maintains adequate records of significant social media communications.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should also keep adequate records of any significant communications. As well as helping to protect consumers, these records enable the firm to deal effectively with any subsequent claims or complaints. Firms should not rely on digital media channels to maintain records, as they will not have control over this: social media in particular may refresh content from time to time, with the consequent deletion of older material.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB has a system in place for the sign-off of digital media communications.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: We remind firms of their obligations to have an adequate system in place to sign off digital media communications. This sign-off should be by a person of appropriate competence and seniority within the organisation.1

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that when TSB using images or infographics in communications (e.g., tweets), the images must be compliant.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: One possible solution to the problem of character limitation is to insert images, including the use of infographics, into communications such as tweets (see figure 5), which allows relatively unrestricted information to be conveyed. Clearly, the image must in itself be compliant.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB acts in good faith towards retail customers in all its dealings.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A firm must act in good faith towards retail customers.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB acts in good faith by demonstrating honesty, fair and open dealing, and consistency with the reasonable expectations of retail customers.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Acting in good faith is a standard of conduct characterised by honesty, fair and open dealing and acting consistently with the reasonable expectations of retail customers.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB avoids causing foreseeable harm to retail customers through its products and services.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A firm must avoid causing foreseeable harm to retail customers.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB address foreseeable harm caused by both acts and omissions, whether directly to a retail customer or through their role in the distribution chain, even if another firm also contributes to the harm.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Foreseeable harm may be caused by both act and omission, in a firm’s direct relationship with a retail customer or through its role in the distribution chain even where another firm in that chain also contributes to the harm.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB enables and supports retail customers to pursue their financial objectives.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A firm must enable and support retail customers to pursue their financial objectives.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's products provide fair value to retail customers.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A manufacturer must ensure that its products provide fair value to retail customers in the target markets for those products.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB communicates information to retail customers in a clear, fair, and not misleading way.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A firm must communicate information to retail customers in a way which is clear, fair and not misleading.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides adequate customer support to retail customers, including those with characteristics of vulnerability.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A firm must design and deliver support to retail customers such that it meets the needs of retail customers, including those with characteristics of vulnerability.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB regularly monitors the outcomes retail customers receive from its products and services.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A firm must regularly monitor the outcomes retail customers receive from: (1) the products the firm manufactures or distributes; (2) the communications the firm has with retail customers; and (3) the customer support the firm provides to retail customers.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB takes appropriate action if retail customers are not receiving good outcomes.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Where a firm identifies that retail customers are not receiving the outcomes listed in PRIN 2A.9.9R, or there is a risk that retail customers will not receive these outcomes, it must take appropriate action to address the situation.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's governance, strategy, and policies reflect the obligations under Principle 12 and PRIN 2A.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A firm must ensure that Principle 12 and the obligations in this chapter are reflected in their strategies, governance, leadership and people policies, including incentives at all levels.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB has implemented the new PRIIPs rules and amendments to the Regulatory Technical Standards by the effective date.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Our changes to the PRIIPs RTS and our new rules will take effect from 25 March 2022. However, firms will have until 31 December 2022 to implement the new changes.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB provides accurate, clear, fair, and non-misleading information in the Key Information Document (KID).
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: The changes that we will make to the RTS should address the existing conflict between PRIIPs requirements. PRIIPs manufacturers are required to ensure the information in the KID is accurate, clear, fair and not misleading while at the same time having to produce and present information on performance and risk in a prescribed way which, in some cases, can be seriously misleading. This should enable market participants to meet the accuracy and fair, clear and not misleading requirements more easily, reducing the risk of decreased trust in the market from consumers receiving misleading information.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Confirm that TSB has removed performance scenarios from the KID and included a narrative description of performance.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: We will proceed with our proposal to remove the requirement for PRIIPs manufacturers to display performance scenarios in the KID.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB has upgraded the Summary Risk Indicator (SRI) score for PRIIPs where necessary.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: We have introduced rules to require PRIIPs manufacturers to upgrade a product's SRI score when the score resulting from the application of the RTS methodology underestimates the level of risk.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB has increased the character limit for disclosures of uncaptured risk in the KID.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: We maintain that increasing the character limit for the description accompanying the SRI will facilitate a more complete summary of key risks.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB has implemented the technical amendments to transaction costs disclosure requirements.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: We proposed several changes to improve the accuracy of transaction cost reporting in the following areas: treatment of anti-dilution, calculation of over-the-counter (OTC) transactions in bonds, calculation of costs of index-tracking funds.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides general information about its information society services in a form and manner that is easily, directly, and permanently accessible.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A person providing an information society service shall make available to the recipient of the service and any relevant enforcement authority, in a form and manner which is easily, directly and permanently accessible, the following information...

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB's commercial communications are clearly identifiable as such and identify the person on whose behalf they are made.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A service provider shall ensure that any commercial communication provided by him and which constitutes or forms part of an information society service shall— (a) be clearly identifiable as a commercial communication; (b) clearly identify the person on whose behalf the commercial communication is made; (c) clearly identify as such any promotional offer (including any discount, premium or gift) and ensure that any conditions which must be met to qualify for it are easily accessible, and presented clearly and unambiguously; and (d) clearly identify as such any promotional competition or game and ensure that any conditions for participation are easily accessible and presented clearly and unambiguously.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB ensures any unsolicited commercial communication sent by electronic mail is clearly and unambiguously identifiable as such as soon as it is received.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A service provider shall ensure that any unsolicited commercial communication sent by him by electronic mail is clearly and unambiguously identifiable as such as soon as it is received.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides the necessary information before a contract is concluded by electronic means, including technical steps to follow, contract filing, and error correction.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Unless parties who are not consumers have agreed otherwise, where a contract is to be concluded by electronic means a service provider shall, prior to an order being placed by the recipient of a service, provide to that recipient in a clear, comprehensible and unambiguous manner the information set out in (a) to (d) below— (a) the different technical steps to follow to conclude the contract; (b) whether or not the concluded contract will be filed by the service provider and whether it will be accessible; ( O.J. L145, 13.6.77, p.1. Directive as last amended by Directive 2002/38/EC; O.J. L128, 15.5.2002, p.41. a) 5 (c) the technical means for identifying and correcting input errors prior to the placing of the order; and (d) the languages offered for the conclusion of the contract.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB acknowledges receipt of orders placed through technological means without undue delay and by electronic means.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Where the recipient of the service places his order through technological means, a service provider shall acknowledge receipt of the order to the recipient of the service without undue delay and by electronic means...

policy_test_cases.Test case: Confirm that TSB has measures in place to allow recipients to identify and correct input errors before placing an order.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A service provider shall make available to the recipient of the service appropriate, effective and accessible technical means allowing him to identify and correct input errors prior to the placing of the order.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB complies with the liability limitations for mere conduit, caching, and hosting services as specified in the regulations.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Where an information society service is provided which consists of the transmission in a communication network of information provided by a recipient of the service or the provision of access to a communication network, the service provider (if he otherwise would) shall not be liable for damages or for any other pecuniary remedy or for any criminal sanction as a result of that transmission...

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's advertisements are prepared with a sense of responsibility to the audience and society.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Advertisements must be prepared with a sense of responsibility to the audience and to society.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB's advertisements comply with the law and that broadcasters make this a condition of acceptance.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Advertisements must comply with the law and broadcasters must make that a condition of acceptance.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB's advertisements do not materially mislead or are likely to do so.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Advertisements must not materially mislead or be likely to do so.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's advertisements do not mislead consumers by omitting material information.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Advertisements must not mislead consumers by omitting material information.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB's advertisements for financial products include all material information such as the main characteristics, price, and identity of the marketer.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: For advertisements that quote prices for an advertised product or service, material information [for the purposes of rule 3.2] includes: 3.3.1 the main characteristics of the product or service MISLEADING ADVERTISING The BCAP Code: The UK Code of Broadcast Advertising 15 3.3.2 the identity (for example, a trading name) and geographical address of the marketer and any other trader on whose behalf the advertiser is acting 3.3.3 the price of the advertised product or service, including taxes, or, if the nature of the product or service is such that the price cannot be calculated in advance, the manner in which the price is calculated 3.3.4 delivery charges 3.3.5 the arrangements for payment, delivery, performance or complaint handling, if those differ from the arrangements that consumers are likely to reasonably expect 3.3.6 that consumers have the right to withdraw or cancel, if they have that right.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Confirm that TSB's advertisements do not falsely imply that the advertiser is acting as a consumer.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Advertisements must not falsely imply that the advertiser is acting as a consumer or for purposes outside its trade, business, craft or profession.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB holds documentary evidence to prove claims that the audience is likely to regard as objective.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Broadcasters must hold documentary evidence to prove claims that the audience is likely to regard as objective and that are capable of objective substantiation.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB's advertisements do not exaggerate the capability or performance of a product or service.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Advertisements must not mislead by exaggerating the capability or performance of a product or service.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB's advertisements do not suggest that their claims are universally accepted if a significant division of informed or scientific opinion exists.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Advertisements must not suggest that their claims are universally accepted if a significant division of informed or scientific opinion exists.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's advertisements for financial products are centrally cleared by Radiocentre.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Radio Central Copy Clearance - Radio broadcasters must ensure advertisements for consumer credit, investment and complex financial products and services are centrally cleared.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that all marketing communications by TSB are legal, decent, honest, and truthful.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Marketing communications should be legal, decent, honest and truthful.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB's marketing communications reflect the spirit, not merely the letter, of the CAP Code.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Marketing communications must reflect the spirit, not merely the letter, of the Code.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's marketing communications are prepared with a sense of responsibility to consumers and society.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Marketing communications must be prepared with a sense of responsibility to consumers and to society.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB complies with all general and sector-specific rules in their marketing communications.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Marketers must comply with all general rules and with relevant sector-specific rules.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's marketing communications do not bring advertising into disrepute.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: No marketing communication should bring advertising into disrepute.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB's marketing communications respect fair competition principles.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Marketing communications must respect the principles of fair competition generally accepted in business.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB responds promptly to ASA's enquiries.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Any unreasonable delay in responding to the ASA's enquiries will normally be considered a breach of the Code.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB provides full name and geographical business address to ASA or CAP when requested.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: The full name and geographical business address of the marketer must be given to the ASA or CAP without delay if requested.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB's marketing communications are not misleading.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Marketing communications must not materially mislead or be likely to do so.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB's marketing communications do not omit material information.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Marketing communications must not mislead the consumer by omitting material information.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides clear, fair, and not misleading product information to business customers.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should ensure that all financial promotions, across all channels, are clear, fair and not misleading.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB employees are trained and knowledgeable about the range of products offered to customers.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should ensure that employees/agents are trained and knowledgeable about the range of products, across all channels, on offer to customers.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB seeks customer consent before sharing any business or personal details with third parties.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should ensure that the customer's consent is sought prior to sharing any business or personal details with a third party or an alternative source of finance.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB provides clear guidance on the information required during the application process.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should ensure that customers are provided with clear guidance on the information and documentation they will need to submit during the application process.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB assesses the customer's ability to repay credit sustainably before providing it.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Before providing any form of credit, granting a limit or increasing the customer's borrowing, Firms should assess, from the information available at the time, whether the customer will be able to repay it in a sustainable manner without incurring financial difficulty.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB provides declined applicants with the primary reason for the decision in writing.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: If an application for a product is declined, the Firm should ensure that it understands the reason(s) behind it in order to be able to convey, where appropriate, this information to the customer. As a minimum, the customer should be provided with the primary reason in writing as to why they have been declined.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB has processes to deal with unauthorised credit card transactions.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should have processes in place to deal with unauthorised credit card transactions. If customer fraud is suspected, the burden of proof is on the Firm to prove this is the case.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB supports business customers showing signs of financial stress.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should have triggers and processes in place to help identify customers who are showing signs of financial stress and should engage with these customers in a sensitive and supportive manner.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB applies an empathetic approach to customers in financial difficulty.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should demonstrate an empathetic approach to the customer's situation; listening to and acting upon information provided by the customer with a view to developing an appropriate and mutually acceptable solution.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure TSB has a vulnerability strategy for identifying and treating vulnerable individuals.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Firms should have a vulnerability strategy, which defines its approach to the identification and treatment of individuals considered to be vulnerable, through whichever channel the customer chooses to engage.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides consumers with all required information prior to the conclusion of a distance contract.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: In good time prior to the consumer being bound by any distance contract, the supplier shall provide to the consumer the information specified in Schedule 1.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB communicates all contractual terms and conditions to the consumer on paper or another durable medium.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: The supplier under a distance contract shall communicate to the consumer on paper, or in another durable medium which is available and accessible to the consumer, all the contractual terms and conditions and the information specified in Schedule 1.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Check that TSB informs consumers about their right to cancel a distance contract and the conditions for exercising it.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Whether or not there is a right of cancellation and, where there is a right of cancellation, its duration and the conditions for exercising it, including information on the amount which the consumer may be required to pay in accordance with regulation 13, as well as the consequences of not exercising that right.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides a cancellation period of at least 14 calendar days for distance contracts.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: The cancellation period begins on the day on which the distance contract is concluded and ends on the expiry of fourteen calendar days beginning with the day after conclusion day.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB refunds any sum paid by the consumer within 30 calendar days if a distance contract is cancelled.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: The supplier shall refund any sum paid by or on behalf of the consumer under or in relation to the contract to the person by whom it was paid, less any charge made in accordance with paragraph (6), as soon as possible and in any event within a period not exceeding 30 calendar days.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Confirm that TSB does not impose any obligation on consumers for unsolicited financial services.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A person who receives unsolicited financial services for purposes other than those of his business from another person who supplies those services in the course of his business, shall not thereby become subject to any obligation.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB does not demand payment for unsolicited financial services.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Where unsolicited financial services are supplied for purposes other than those of the recipient's business, and a person includes with the supply of those services a demand for payment, or an assertion of a present or prospective right to payment in respect of those services, that person is guilty of an offence.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB does not include any contractual term that is inconsistent with the application of these Regulations.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A term contained in any contract is void if, and to the extent that, it is inconsistent with the application of a provision of these Regulations to a distance contract.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides a fee information document to consumers in good time before entering into a contract for a payment account.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Any payment service provider that offers a payment account must ensure that, in good time before entering into a contract for a payment account with a consumer, it provides the consumer with a fee information document.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB makes the fee information document and glossary available to consumers at any time, both electronically and in physical premises.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Any payment service provider that offers a payment account must ensure that the fee information document and the glossary are made available to consumers at any time; provided in an easily accessible manner, including to non-customers in electronic form on the payment service provider's website where available; and in the premises of the payment service provider which are accessible to consumers.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides an annual statement of fees free of charge to all consumers holding a payment account.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: Any payment service provider that offers a payment account must provide an annual statement of fees ('statement of fees') free of charge to all consumers holding a payment account with it.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB offers a switching service between payment accounts denominated in the same currency and located in the UK.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A payment service provider must offer a switching service between payment accounts that are denominated in the same currency; and opened or held with a payment service provider located in the United Kingdom.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB does not discriminate against consumers legally resident in the EU by reason of their nationality or place of residence when applying for or accessing a payment account.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A credit institution must not discriminate against consumers legally resident in the European Union by reason of their nationality or place of residence or by reason of any other ground referred to in Article 21 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union when those consumers apply for or access a payment account.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Ensure that TSB offers a payment account with basic features to eligible consumers and does not charge any fee for the services set out in regulation 19(1) when those services are provided as part of a payment account with basic features.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A credit institution must not charge any fee for the services set out in regulation 19(1) when those services are provided as part of a payment account with basic features.

policy_test_cases.Test case: Verify that TSB provides information about the switching service, including roles, time limits, fees, and consumer rights, free of charge and in an accessible manner.
policy_test_cases.Excerpt: A payment service provider must make available to consumers the following information about the switching service— (a) the roles of the transferring and receiving payment service providers as provided for in this Schedule; (b) the time limits that apply to the completion of the tasks provided for in this Schedule; (c) any fees that are to be be charged; (d) details of any information that the consumer is required to provide; (e) details of the consumer’s right to make a complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service. (2) The information referred to in sub-paragraph (1) must be made available — (a) free of charge on paper or another durable medium at all premises of the payment service provider which are accessible to consumers; and (b) in electronic form on the payment service provider’s website at all times.
